channel.title: If you know how to host a server come here! please
channel.description: Hello i need help i just finished scripting my server. and theres one minor problem i want to run it for a beta test with my buddy so we could check out if something is missing but i have no idea how i can host it so my friend could join? i have https://www.noip.com personal help would be great :)

item.title: If you know how to host a server come here! please
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

Open up command prompt and type “ipconfig” and memorize the number next to default gate.

Go into your internet browser and type in that number, enter the required credentials, if you don’t know try “admin” as the username and look underneath your router to see the factory password.

Some people have different routers so look for something that has ports inside it, for mine it is under the Applications & Gaming tab.

Fill out all the spaces, enable both the TCP and UDP and enter a port that isn’t used - preferably something between 2000 and 4000

Save the settings, make sure your no-ip is redirecting to your correct port and give the details to your buddy

That should allow your server to receive connections

Read full topic
item.source: If you know how to host a server come here! please

item.title: If you know how to host a server come here! please
item.dc:creator: @arean arean
item.description:
@arean wrote:

First enable the port of your server on the firewall you are using. Go to canyouseeme.org to see if your ip is blocking the port used.

I’m hoping you know how to portforward, if you do then start changing the defalt ip on your server to your no-ip. Make sure if you want to keep your server online with No-Ip, the No-Ip software must be running at all times.

Read full topic
item.source: If you know how to host a server come here! please
